speaker: Martin
text: Boo!

speaker: Frasier
text: That is not funny!  You don't sneak up on someone and startle them!

speaker: Martin
text: First of all, it's very funny.  And secondly, I only did it to prove a point.

speaker: Ronee
text: And you called it: he does scream like a woman.

speaker: Frasier
text: I do not scream like a woman.  It was a manly throaty wail.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, you may want to call security.  As I got off the elevator, I heard a woman screaming hysterically.

speaker: Frasier
text: That was me!  I was innocently conducting some Brahms and our madcap father decided to startle me.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, quit whinin'.  I used to scare you kids all the time when we went camping and you used to love it.  Remember the story about the couple making out in the car who got slashed by the killer with the hook?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, and I remember I couldn't kiss a woman in a car until I was thirty.

speaker: Ronee
text: Well, your father doesn't have that problem, Mr. Reclining Bucket Seats.

speaker: Frasier
text: Want me to scream again?

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, when'd you get the new cane?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, Ronee got it for me.

speaker: Ronee
text: Yeah, he's to young for that old-man cane.  This is much more his style.

speaker: Martin
text: Give me a top hat and I'm Fred Astaire.

speaker: Frasier
text: Add a monocle and you're Mr. Peanut.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, coulrophobia?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I have a patient who suffers from it.

speaker: Martin
text: What is it?

speaker: Frasier
text: It's a very rare disorder: a crippling fear of clowns.  Yes, I'm treating a pediatric nurse who's terrified every time one comes to visit the children at her hospital.  It's almost cost her her job.

speaker: Niles
text: Poor thing.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, although we're making great progress, though.  Some rather ground-breaking techniques I've devised.  I think we're close to a cure.

speaker: Niles
text: Really?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  I wouldn't be surprised if this may turn out to be my clowning achievement.

speaker: Niles
text: That sounded better in you head, didn't it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Vastly.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I don't blame her for hatin' clowns.  They're weird and creepy.  That's one of the reasons I never took you kids to the circus.

speaker: Niles
text: Which I always resented.  You know how much I wanted to be a trapeze artist.  I even decorated a unitard in the style of the Flying Wallendas to wear when we visited the big top.

speaker: Martin
text: That was the other reason.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'll go check on dinner.

speaker: Ronee
text: Oh, you know, I'm gonna have to make this an early evening. I'm leaving in the morning to visit my mother.  She moved last year to Spokane.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_stopping at the kitchen door_] I remember your mom.  She used to chaperone our dances, right?

speaker: Ronee
text: Oh yeah.  She also taught Sunday school and led the church choir.

speaker: Frasier
text: It must have been a very windy day when the apple fell from that tree.  _Martin and Ronee give him sarcastic smiles.  FADE OUT_ **SEND IN THE CLOWN** _Scene 2 - Frasier's Office Fade in.  Frasier is sitting with his coulrophobic patient, Mimi, winding a jack-in-the-box._  [_N.B. Stephanie Faracy also played a character named Mimi in[[5.06]](/frasier/transcripts/season_5/episode_6/voyage_of_the_damned.html "Voyage Of The Damned"), "Voyage of the Damned" though that character was a randy, high society lush._]

speaker: Frasier
text: You're doing fine, Mimi, there's nothing to be afraid of.

speaker: Mimi
text: Right.

speaker: Frasier
text: Just a tiny inanimate piece of plastic.  It couldn't possibly hurt you.

speaker: Mimi
text: I know.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're doing great.

speaker: Mimi
text: I feel good.

speaker: Frasier
text: Much better.

speaker: Mimi
text: Really?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes.  You're still in the room, you didn't throw up. It's a big improvement.  All right now, give me your hand. [_He takes it and puts it on the jack-in-the-box._]  Here's the tiny little hat.

speaker: Mimi
text: Tiny little hat, right.

speaker: Frasier
text: And the big red nose.

speaker: Mimi
text: The big red nose.

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, Mimi, is there anything you'd like to say to our little clown friend?

speaker: Mimi
text: Please don't kill me!

speaker: Frasier
text: No!  No, Mimi.

speaker: Mimi
text: Oh, uh, I mean, you're my friend and I like you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Excellent, Mimi.  All right then.  Now, tomorrow we will take our biggest step yet.

speaker: Mimi
text: No, I really don't think that...

speaker: Frasier
text: No, you are ready.  You are.  In the safety of this environment, you will watch me transform myself into a real live clown. I will apply the make up, and then I'll put on the clown suit and the big funny shoes. And, time permitting, I will make animal balloons.

speaker: Mimi
text: And you really think that'll work?

speaker: Frasier
text: As long as you don't ask for anything too complicated, like a giraffe.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, our time is up.  All right then, Mimi, I will see you tomorrow.

speaker: Frasier
text: Rest assured, I will talk you through every step of the way. There's nothing to be afraid of.  There will be no surprises.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm so, so sorry.  Yes, here.  There he goes.

speaker: Frasier
text: I will see you later, then. _The clown pops out yet again, bringing another scream.  Frasier frantically closes it._

speaker: Frasier
text: Again, I am so sorry.  Little fella really is full of mischief, isn't he?

speaker: Mimi
text: You mean you're not controlling him?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes!  Of course I am!  Anyway, I will see you tomorrow. Double session. _Mimi hurries out the door, a panicked look on her face.  Frasier walks back to his desk and tosses the jack-in-the-box into the trash.  He then leans over to jot down some notes.  Martin comes in the door and, seeing that Frasier's back is turned, sneaks over, picks up an African mask and moves behind his son. Frasier stands up and turns, ending up face to face with the mask._

speaker: Martin
text: Boo! _Frasier squawks and reels back as Martin bursts out laughing. Recovering, Frasier indignantly takes the mask from Martin._

speaker: Frasier
text: What is the matter with you?!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you keep standing in empty rooms with your back to the door, I'm only human.  I wish Ronee could've seen that one.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I'm glad your little girlfriend is making you feel young again, but you're acting like an irresponsible adolescent.

speaker: Martin
text: [_in a nasal mimic_] Irresponsible adolescent.

speaker: Frasier
text: Mimicking me now!

speaker: Martin
text: Mimicking me now!

speaker: Frasier
text: Stop it!  Did you specifically come down here to torture me?

speaker: Martin
text: No, I'm picking up Niles for a movie, but he's still got someone in his office.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, as do I, unfortunately.  Now off you go.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, when did you forget how to have fun?  You've turned into such a fuddy-duddy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well forgive me if I prefer humor of a more elevated level. I tell you what, I might actually enjoy one of your japes someday if you could come up with something with a bit more wit and sophistication. _Martin leaves and Frasier sits at his desk to work on his notes. The phone rings and he answers._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello?  Yes, well I'm afraid my calendar is rather booked right now.  All right, I suppose I could try to squeeze you in somewhere.  And your last name, please?  Rection. That's unusual.  And your first name? ...That's not funny either, Dad. _He hangs up the phone and sits there, fuming.  FADE TO:  Scene 3 - Frasier's Apartment Fade in.  Frasier opens the front door, Roz is there and hands him a small bag._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hello, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Hi.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thanks for bringing that over.

speaker: Roz
text: No problem.  I'm warning you, though, that clown makeup is a bitch to get off.  I wore it for Alice's birthday party and for a whole week after, I looked like a kabuki hooker.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes, that was around the time of the SeaBee Awards.  I remember now, you were rather comically made up that night.

speaker: Roz
text: [_mad_] I'd gotten it off by then.

speaker: Martin
text: Yoo-hoo, Frasier, don't be afraid.  I'm comin' in the door.

speaker: Frasier
text: Very funny, Dad.  Roz, do you think it's funny when somebody sneaks up behind you and jolts you out of your skin?

speaker: Roz
text: Let me guess: somebody screamed like a woman.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, all right.  Good night, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Bye.

speaker: Frasier
text: I thought you were having dinner with Niles.

speaker: Martin
text: He cancelled, something came up.  I'm just gonna watch the game in my room.  But don't worry.  If I come out for a beer, I'll call ahead.  Wouldn't want you to think there was an intruder in the house.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's about ten years too late for that. _They head off to the bedrooms, then Frasier stops, turns back and sets the box down.  He's just had a wicked idea._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_calling_] Dad, I'm gonna go out for a while.  See you later.

speaker: Martin
text: [_calling from his room_] See ya. _Frasier opens the front door, jingles his keys, then closes the door while still inside.  He hurries back, grabs the box and takes it to his library.  DISSOLVE TO: Later, as he steps out, fully dressed and made up as a clown. He quietly steps into the living room, thinks a moment, then goes to the kitchen and retrieves a meat cleaver.  He goes to the front door and rings the bell several times, then hides in the powder room.  Martin comes into the living room to answer the door, checking the hall.  While his back is turned, Frasier creeps from the powder room and strikes a menacing pose with the cleaver, waiting until Martin turns to face him, then letting out a roar.  Martin howls and rears back, falling to the floor as Frasier bursts out laughing._

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, you're right, Dad, that's hilarious.  Not such a fuddy-duddy now, am I?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that's quite a comeback, Dad, a heart attack.  Come on, get up.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad?  Dad, you can get up now.  Dad! _FADE OUT  End of Act 1  Act 2  Scene 1 - The Hospital Fade in.  Frasier, still in clown regalia, is in the waiting room. Niles rushes off the elevator._

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: How's Dad?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, he's resting, he's stable.  His color is good.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank God.  Can I see him?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, they're running some tests right now.  The doctor should be out in a minute.

speaker: Niles
text: How did this happen?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, there's... so many factors in a case like this, Niles. It's impossible to pinpoint any one cause in particular.

speaker: Niles
text: Why are you dressed like that?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well... Oh, all right. You remember my patient with the clown phobia?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, yes, of course, I'm sorry.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles, I feel just terrible about this.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, you feel terrible?  I was supposed to have dinner with him tonight and I cancelled on him.  I would have been with him when it happened, but no, I had to try out those new bath emollients.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, no point in trying to assign blame at a time like this, Niles.  We must remember that.

speaker: Niles
text: You probably saved his life.  [_to a woman sitting in a chair_] Our father had a heart attack, this man saved his life!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm sure you would've done the same thing if you were in my shoes, Niles.  [_to the woman_]  Well, not these shoes, of course.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Roz, hi.

speaker: Roz
text: Here are your clothes.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Roz
text: How's your dad?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, he's fine now, thanks to Frasier's grace under pressure.

speaker: Man
text: You know they say the first few minutes are critical?

speaker: Roz
text: Did you give him an aspirin?

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh, yes, I did.

speaker: Roz
text: He's been taking care of his dad for ten years.

speaker: Woman
text: God bless him.  What a good son.

speaker: Nurse
text: Uh, excuse me Dr. Crane, I have to verify the paramedic's report.  Around seven o'clock this evening you pretended to leave your apartment...

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, that's right, it's all there, off you go.

speaker: Nurse
text: Then you dressed up like a clown and lured you father into the living room where you leapt out waving a meat cleaver causing him to collapse.

speaker: Niles
text: You scared him on purpose?

speaker: Frasier
text: It was a joke!

speaker: Niles
text: You know how much he hates clowns!  [_to the others_]  My father hates clowns.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well it was only meant as a playful little jolt.

speaker: Roz
text: Why didn't you just throw a toaster in his tub?

speaker: Doctor
text: Dr. Crane?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes.

speaker: Doctor
text: Your father's doing well.  He appears to have suffered a mild cardiac event.

speaker: Frasier
text: And what does that mean, exactly?

speaker: Doctor
text: Well, basically it's a warning.  He'll need to change his diet, start exercising.  Anyway, he should be able to go home tomorrow.

speaker: Frasier
text: What a relief!  He's going to be okay!

speaker: Roz
text: No thanks to you!

speaker: Niles
text: Look at you.  You just stand there with a smile on your face.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's makeup, you idiot!  May I remind you all that this was an accident?

speaker: Frasier
text: It was meant as a harmless amusement.  I will not stand here and be demonized for this.  I am not a monster! _The elevator opens.  Mimi, the coulrophobic nurse, is inside.  Upon seeing Frasier she lets out a shriek and turns away.  Turning back to escape the confines of the elevator, she is confronted by Frasier once more and screams again, finally collapsing against the elevator rail as Frasier runs the other way.  FADE TO:_ **DE-FIBBING** _Scene 2 - Frasier's Apartment Fade in.  Eddie is waiting on the couch as Martin and the boys come in the front.  Frasier is carrying Martin's bag from the hospital, Niles has some bouquets which he sets on the coffee table and the dinner table._

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay, Dad, now just take it easy.

speaker: Martin
text: I'm fine.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, there's my guy.  Daddy's home from the little vacation your brother Frasier sent me on.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, Dad.

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne's on her way over to join us for a nice, heart-smart dinner.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.  Oh, and Dad, you really should take a look at this list the hospital sent home with us.  Now, the foods that have a little picture of a, a smiling heart next to them are good for you.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, I cracked the code already.  Frasier, I wish you'd stop coddling me.  I know you're sorry and you didn't mean to give me a heart attack.

speaker: Frasier
text: Not a heart attack, Dad, a, a cardiac event.  You know, maybe we can look on this as a sign that you should begin a healthier lifestyle.  Perhaps one day we'll look back on this and you'll thank me for it.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes.  Maybe then you can find a nice card for Frasier, like "Now that I'm old and looking back, I thank you for my heart attack."

speaker: Frasier
text: Cardiac event!

speaker: Martin
text: Here, give me this.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Dad, here.  I'll take this to your room for you.  Why don't you just sit down and rest?

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, were you able to reach Ronee at her mom's?

speaker: Martin
text: Nope.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, here, you can try her now.

speaker: Martin
text: No, because I'm not tellin' her.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Martin
text: She doesn't need to know every little thing that goes on in my life.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, you had a heart attack!

speaker: Martin
text: Cardiac event.  And it's over.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad...

speaker: Martin
text: It's over.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, are you afraid she'll start seeing you differently?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you see me differently.  "Let me have that suitcase, Dad."  "Just sit down and rest."  I don't need her thinkin' of me as some feeble old guy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Do you really want to keep such an enormous secret from her?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, not forever.  You and Niles can tell her after I'm dead.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, that'll be Daphne.

speaker: Martin
text: She's not cookin', is she?  I just got out of the hospital! _Niles stops to give him an outraged look, then opens the door.  It is Ronee._ [_N.B. Daphne does not appear in this episode, except for the tag.  Jane Leeves was probably on maternity leave.  In the next episode filmed, "Caught In The Act" (which aired before this one) she was back to normal and wore a fake stomach for Daphne's bump._]

speaker: Niles
text: Ronee.

speaker: Ronee
text: Surprise, boys, and start pourin'.  How ya doin', sweetie?

speaker: Martin
text: Hey.  I thought you were at your mother's.

speaker: Ronee
text: Oh, you know, I cut it short.  It was just too depressing. Ever since her operation, she just sits around all day like she's a hundred.

speaker: Ronee
text: Nice flowers. [_reads the card_] "Get well soon"?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I got those for Frasier.  He has a little... man problem.

speaker: Martin
text: Flares up every once in a while.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier has a... man problem.

speaker: Frasier
text: Shut up, ya nit!

speaker: Ronee
text: Hey, thank God for antibiotics, huh?  I'll be right back and then you wanna go out and get some ribs?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, sounds great.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I'm not tellin' her.  You heard what she said about her mother.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, you're not going to be able to keep this from her.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, watch me.

speaker: Frasier
text: And how are you going to explain the fact that you can't eat ribs tonight?  Or the new medication that you're on?  Or the fact that you can't have sex for the next two weeks?

speaker: Martin
text: Who says?

speaker: Frasier
text: It's on the list!

speaker: Niles
text: What little picture is next to that one?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, listen, uh, if she's not able to handle something like this, isn't it better if you know now?

speaker: Ronee
text: Okay, Marty, let's go pig out.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, help me put this stuff away, will you?  Good seeing you again, Ronee.

speaker: Ronee
text: Yeah, you too.  I'm glad you're feeling better.

speaker: Frasier
text: Sorry?

speaker: Ronee
text: You know, your man problem.

speaker: Frasier
text: Keep laughing and you're gonna have a man problem.

speaker: Martin
text: You know, I'm not that hungry right now.  Do you mind if we just sit for a while?

speaker: Ronee
text: No, that's fine.  You want me to go get you a beer?

speaker: Martin
text: No.  So, uh, good weather over there in Spokane?

speaker: Ronee
text: God, no.  It rained the entire time.  I basically just sat there and made boring small talk with my mother.  God, I hate small talk.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, tell me.  Rained here some, too. _CUT TO: Martin's bedroom.  Frasier and Niles come in and start putting Martin's things away._

speaker: Niles
text: I don't know.  I just hope it doesn't scare her off.

speaker: Frasier
text: Maybe she might surprise us.

speaker: Niles
text: Does Ronee ever... spend the night here?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, on occasion.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, good.  'Cause there's some underwear in here that I was really hoping didn't belong to Dad.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, look at this: Dad was right.  We're camping and we're having fun.  Look how happy we are.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, the car's packed.  We're leaving.  God, what pains we were.  Didn't want to get our hands dirty, didn't want to go fishing, didn't want to sleep on the ground.  But he kept taking us, year after year, just so he could spend time with us.

speaker: Niles
text: And frighten us to death with stories of hook-armed slashers.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, no matter how frightened I got, as soon as Dad started laughing again I knew that everything was safe. You know, I'm not ready to lose him, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Me neither.  And I don't want my child to miss knowing him. Who else is going to teach him how to catch a football ball?

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, eleven years ago when he moved in here, I couldn't imagine a bigger infringement on my life.  Now, I can't imagine my life without him.

speaker: Niles
text: It would be very hard to walk into this apartment and see that chair and know that Dad wasn't here anymore.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I'd get rid of that chair immediately. _CUT TO: the living room. Martin and Ronee are still sitting awkwardly on the couch._

speaker: Martin
text: So, you made the trip on one tank of gas?  Wow.

speaker: Ronee
text: Yeah, that was really one for the books.  Okay, Marty, what's going on?

speaker: Martin
text: What?

speaker: Ronee
text: Well, I feel like you've got something on your mind that you're not telling me.

speaker: Martin
text: No, I don't.  It's just...  Boy, this is hard.  I'm just nervous about what you're gonna to say.

speaker: Ronee
text: Marty, just...

speaker: Martin
text: Yesterday, I had a mild, very mild, cardiac event.

speaker: Ronee
text: A what?

speaker: Martin
text: I had a little heart attack.

speaker: Ronee
text: And that's it?

speaker: Martin
text: What do you mean, "that's it"?  I had a heart attack, for God's sake!

speaker: Ronee
text: Well, no surgery, home the next day, that's a bee sting. Did they use the paddles?

speaker: Martin
text: No.

speaker: Ronee
text: Well, talk to me after they've used the paddles.

speaker: Martin
text: You had the paddles?

speaker: Ronee
text: All right, let's just say I didn't have the best lipo guy, okay?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I'm sorry it's not dramatic enough for you.

speaker: Ronee
text: Look, after all that build up, I just thought it would be something bigger, all right?  Like you were gonna break up with me or pop the question or something.  And FYI, the next time you're in the hospital, I would appreciate a phone call if it's not too much trouble.

speaker: Martin
text: Fine!  And FYI I'm not breakin' up with you.

speaker: Ronee
text: Well, I know that now.

speaker: Martin
text: And if I was gonna do that other thing, it wouldn't be here.

speaker: Ronee
text: What other thing?

speaker: Martin
text: Pop the question.

speaker: Ronee
text: Oh.

speaker: Martin
text: It'd be someplace romantic, for God's sake.  Uh... tablecloths!

speaker: Ronee
text: Nice.

speaker: Martin
text: Damn right it'd be nice.  So?

speaker: Ronee
text: So, what?

speaker: Martin
text: So what would you have said?

speaker: Ronee
text: Well, how should I know?  You didn't ask me.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, so say I am now.

speaker: Ronee
text: What?

speaker: Martin
text: Asking you.

speaker: Ronee
text: Well, are you or are aren't you?

speaker: Martin
text: I am.

speaker: Ronee
text: Okay then.

speaker: Martin
text: Okay.  Okay what?

speaker: Ronee
text: Okay I will.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah?

speaker: Ronee
text: Yeah.

speaker: Martin
text: Okay.

speaker: Ronee
text: Okay. _Martin seems satisfied for a moment, then gets a confused look on his face.  So does Ronee.  CUT TO: Martin's bedroom.  Frasier is sitting on the dresser, talking to Niles._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, maybe Dad's right.  I am getting stuck in my ways.  I like the way things are, I don't want them to change.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, don't worry, he's not going anywhere for a while.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey guys, guess what?  I'm gettin' married!

speaker: Ronee
text: Well, come on boys, give your ol' mom a kiss! _She pulls the shocked pair into a hug.  FADE OUT._
